item.title: Happy never after: divorce in SA
item.dc:creator: Le Roux Schoeman
item.description:
Wedding venues might be a b$tch to book, but South Africans are also keeping the divorce court pretty busy. Now new data can help you “divorce-proof” your union a little bit, at least statistically-speaking. Happily never after Divorce in SAInfographic This visualisation was first published by Women 24 on 23 June 2016 Resources StatsSA Venngage

The post Happy never after: divorce in SA appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Mapping Tshwane: How the flames spread
item.dc:creator: Andrea Teagle
item.description:
Three people have been killed and at least 54 arrested in Tshwane after unrest resulting from the ANC’s appointment of Thoko Didiza as its mayoral candidate. As the ANC scrambles to end the violence, there are growing calls to hold the responsible to account and worries about increasing political violence ahead of the local government […]

The post Mapping Tshwane: How the flames spread appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Metros falling way behind in issuing of property title deeds
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
Administrative problems, together with a failure to root out abuse of the housing allocation system, is tripping up the delivery of title deeds to beneficiaries in the country’s cities, with one metro failing to hand over any title deeds in two years. Human Settlements Minister Lindiwe Sisulu told MPs in a recent written reply to […]

The post Metros falling way behind in issuing of property title deeds appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Welcome to Los Angeles, Cape Town
item.dc:creator: Sarah Evans
item.description:
As far as informal settlements go, Los Angeles is one of the most unusual you will ever find.

The post Welcome to Los Angeles, Cape Town appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The Forgotten People
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
Thousands of people in 97 informal settlements were not counted in the 2011 census, a data-driven investigation has revealed.

The post The Forgotten People appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Between countries
item.dc:creator: Farren Collins
item.description:
When Ghislain’s father died in Congo Brazzaville last year, the threat of either prison or death meant the 35 year old father of one could not go home to bury him. Instead, he wept alone in his room in the house he takes care of in Cape Town. After civil war broke out in Congo […]

The post Between countries appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The exodus of teachers from SA is not slowing down
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
SA is losing thousands of teachers annually, and most are headed to the United Kingdom. Teachers battling to get by in SA are opting to relocate to the UK, Australia, Canada and other countries where they can earn better salaries, save money or make enough to pay off their debts, according to data analysis conducted […]

The post The exodus of teachers from SA is not slowing down appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Cauliflower sales: A head for figures
item.dc:creator: Larry Claasen
item.description:
Rest easy. If you are on the Banting diet, you cannot be held responsible for the increase in cauliflower prices — at the wholesale level anyway — over the past few months. Demand for cauliflower, especially in suburban supermarkets, has increased. The Banting diet was made popular by sports health scientist Tim Noakes in his book, […]

The post Cauliflower sales: A head for figures appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
